Header: ASEAN chair pledge close regional partnership to tackle international trade frictions
Content: Leaders of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations attended the opening ceremony of the 35th regional summit, as Thai Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha this year’s ASEAN chair highlighted the need for close partnership and relations to overcome global challenges on international trade ‘frictions’. Leaders from the 10-member states of ASEAN have started their three-day meeting in Thailand. The leaders will also join an East Asia Summit along with officials from Australia, China, India, Japan, New Zealand, South Korea, the United States and Russia.
